technical.h1Heading: SSHO Services for Federal Military Construction Projects

elements.text: SSHO Services for Federal Military Construction Projects
Subheading: SDVOSB-Certified Site Safety Health Officers | EM 385-1-1 Experts | California & Nationwide

Hero Text: EHS Analytical Solutions provides certified Site Safety and Health Officers (SSHO) for federal military construction projects throughout California and nationwide. As a Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Business (SDVOSB), we help prime contractors meet their small business subcontracting goals while ensuring full compliance with EM 385-1-1 safety requirements on USACE, NAVFAC, Air Force, and VA construction projects.

elements.description: Construction site with workers wearing hard hats and safety vests, or military installation construction project

elements.text: Why Federal Contractors Choose EHS Analytical Solutions for SSHO Services

Intro Text: As a prime contractor on federal military construction projects, you need SSHO services from a qualified partner who understands EM 385-1-1 requirements and can help you meet small business subcontracting goals. Layout: 3-column layout with icons Column 1: SDVOSB Certified We're a certified Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Business (SDVOSB), helping you meet federal subcontracting goals on USACE, NAVFAC, Air Force, Army, and VA construction projects. Our veteran leadership (USMC & Navy) understands military culture and base operations. Column 2: EM 385-1-1 Experts Our Certified Industrial Hygienists (CIH) and Certified Safety Professionals (CSP) are experts in EM 385-1-1 safety requirements. We develop site-specific Accident Prevention Plans (APP), Activity Hazard Analyses (AHA), conduct safety inspections, provide training, and ensure full compliance on your federal construction projects.  We also utilize highly experienced CSPs or Construction Health and Safety Technicians (CHST) to serve as full-time SSHOs on your project. Column 3: California & Nationwide Coverage Based in San Diego with extensive experience at California military installations and nationwide federal facilities, we provide dedicated SSHO services for projects of all sizes - from small renovations to major multi-year construction programs.
Comprehensive SSHO Services for Federal Construction
Intro Text: Our Site Safety and Health Officers provide complete construction safety support throughout your project lifecycle, from pre-construction planning through project closeout.
Services List (with checkmarks):
Federal Construction Projects We Support
Intro Text:

Our SSHO team has extensive experience supporting contractors on federal construction projects for: U.S. Army Corps of Engineers (USACE) - Military construction, civil works, environmental remediation Naval Facilities Engineering Systems Command (NAVFAC) - Navy and Marine Corps facilities construction, renovation, and repair projects Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) - Medical center construction, renovation, and facility improvements U.S. Air Force and Space Force - Installation construction, airfield improvements, facility modernization Department of Defense (DoD) - Multi-agency military construction programs General Services Administration (GSA) - Federal building construction and renovation
California Military Installations & Nationwide Coverage
Intro Text: Based in San Diego, California, we provide SSHO services throughout California and nationwide. Our team has extensive experience at major California military installations including:
San Diego Area:

items: Marine Corps Recruit Depot San Diego

elements.text: Southern California:

Marine Corps Air Ground Combat Center Twentynine Palms

elements.text: Central & Northern California:
We also provide SSHO services nationwide for federal construction projects at military installations throughout the United States.
Certified Safety Professionals You Can Trust
Intro Text:
Our Site Safety and Health Officers hold the highest industry certifications:

items: EM 385-1-1 Safety and Health Requirements Training

elements.text: Our veteran-owned leadership brings military experience (USMC & U.S. Navy) and understands the unique requirements of working on active military installations.
Partner with an SDVOSB for Your Next Federal Construction Project

Body Text: Looking for a reliable SSHO partner for your USACE, NAVFAC, or other federal construction project? Contact us today for a capability statement and project quote. We respond to all inquiries within 24 hours.
CTA Buttons (side by side): Button 1: 'Request a Quote' → Link to Contact page Button 2: 'Call (619) 288-3094' → Phone link

Frequently Asked Questions About SSHO Services Q1: What is an SSHO? A Site Safety and Health Officer (SSHO) is a qualified safety professional who serves as the contractor's primary safety representative on federal construction projects. The SSHO ensures compliance with EM 385-1-1 safety requirements, conducts daily inspections, develops safety plans, provides worker training, and serves as the main point of contact for government safety inspectors. Q2: When is an SSHO required? USACE, NAVFAC, and most federal construction contracts require a dedicated SSHO when the contract value exceeds $5 million or when the contracting officer determines project hazards warrant it. Review your contract's Section 01 35 26 for specific SSHO requirements. Q3: What qualifications does your SSHO staff have? Our SSHO team includes Certified Industrial Hygienists (CIH), Certified Safety Professionals (CSP), and Construction Health and Safety Technicians (CHST). All staff have 30-Hour OSHA Construction Safety certification, EM 385-1-1 training, and extensive experience on federal military construction projects. Q4: How does working with an SDVOSB help my company? As a certified Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Business, we help prime contractors meet their small business subcontracting goals on federal projects. Subcontracting with us counts toward your SDVOSB participation requirements, helping you maintain compliance and improve your past performance record for future federal opportunities. Q5: What's your geographic coverage? We're based in San Diego and primarily serve California military installations, but we provide SSHO services nationwide for federal construction projects. Contact us to discuss your project location. Q6: How quickly can you mobilize an SSHO? We maintain a team of ready SSHO professionals and can typically mobilize within 1-2 weeks of contract award, depending on base access clearance timelines. technical.metaDescription: Comprehensive safety services for Caltrans construction projects. DVBE-certified Safety Representatives, SQCM, Work Area Monitoring. All 12 Caltrans districts served.

elements.text: Caltrans Construction Safety Services
Subheading: DVBE-Certified Safety & Health Services for California Highway Construction

Hero Text: EHS Analytical Solutions provides comprehensive safety and health services for Caltrans construction projects across all 12 California districts. As a Disabled Veteran Business Enterprise (DVBE), we support general contractors with Safety Representatives, Safety Quality Control Managers, Work Area Monitoring, and complete Cal/OSHA compliance programs for highway and bridge construction.

elements.description: Caltrans highway construction project, bridge work, or Cal/OSHA safety inspection

elements.text: Caltrans Safety & Health Expertise

Body Text: With extensive experience in Caltrans Standard Specifications and Special Provisions, our Certified Industrial Hygienists (CIH) and Certified Safety Professionals (CSP) provide the safety oversight and compliance documentation required for successful Caltrans project completion. We serve all 12 Caltrans districts and understand the unique requirements of California highway construction. Our team is thoroughly trained in Cal/OSHA Title 8 regulations, Caltrans Standard Specifications Section 7 (Safety Requirements), and California-specific construction safety protocols.
Comprehensive Caltrans Safety Services Layout: Grid format with 6 service boxes

Service Box 1: Lead Compliance Plan (LCP) Services For projects involving lead-containing paint on bridges and structures, we develop comprehensive Lead Compliance Plans per Cal/OSHA Section 1532.1 and Caltrans Special Provisions Section 7-1.02K9. Our CIH-certified staff handle exposure assessment, engineering controls, worker training, and ongoing compliance monitoring. Learn more about our dedicated Lead Compliance Plan Services → [Link to: /lead-compliance-plan-services/]

Service Box 2: Safety Representative Services Our Safety Representatives provide on-site safety oversight and Cal/OSHA compliance monitoring for Caltrans construction projects. Services include daily jobsite inspections, safety meeting facilitation, incident investigation, and coordination with Caltrans Resident Engineers per Section 5-1.28 Project Safety Reviews.
Key Responsibilities:

items: Daily safety inspections and hazard identification
Safety meeting coordination with Resident Engineer
Job Hazard Analysis (JHA) review per Section 5-1.29

elements.text: Service Box 3: Public Health and Safety Plan (PHSP) We develop comprehensive Public Health and Safety Plans for Caltrans projects requiring stakeholder coordination and public safety protocols. Our plans address construction impacts on surrounding communities, emergency response procedures, and regulatory compliance for projects near schools, hospitals, and residential areas.
PHSP Components:

items: Traffic control and pedestrian safety measures

elements.text: Service Box 4: Work Area Monitoring (WAM) - Bridge Projects For bridge rehabilitation and painting projects, we provide Work Area Monitoring services including air quality monitoring, worker exposure assessment, and real-time compliance verification. Our monitoring programs ensure contractor adherence to Lead Compliance Plans and protect workers from lead, silica, and other construction hazards.
WAM Services Include:

items: Personal and area air monitoring for lead and silica

elements.text: Service Box 5: Health & Safety Plan (HSP) Development We create site-specific Health & Safety Plans tailored to your Caltrans project requirements. Our plans integrate Cal/OSHA regulations, Caltrans Standard Specifications, and project-specific hazard controls to provide comprehensive safety management throughout construction.
HSP Elements:

Service Box 6: Safety Quality Control Manager (SQCM) Our Safety Quality Control Managers provide senior-level safety oversight and ensure quality assurance for all safety-related activities on Caltrans projects. SQCM services include safety program audits, documentation review, Cal/OSHA compliance verification, and coordination with project quality control teams.
SQCM Responsibilities:
Why Choose EHS Analytical Solutions? Layout: 3-column layout with icons

Column 1: DVBE Certified - 5% Bid Advantage As a Disabled Veteran Business Enterprise certified by the California Department of General Services, we help prime contractors meet Caltrans DVBE participation goals. Our subcontract provides a 5% bid advantage on California state projects. DVBE Certification #2017031

Column 2: All 12 Caltrans Districts Served From Eureka to San Diego, we provide safety services across all Caltrans districts. Our team understands district-specific requirements, local Cal/OSHA enforcement patterns, and regional construction practices. We've successfully completed projects in every California district.

Column 3: CIH & CSP Certified Professionals Our principals hold the highest professional credentials: Certified Industrial Hygienist (CIH), Certified Safety Professional (CSP), and Certified Asbestos Consultant (CAC). We bring senior-level expertise to every Caltrans project, not entry-level technicians.
We Serve All 12 Caltrans Districts

Body Text: EHS Analytical Solutions provides safety services for Caltrans construction projects throughout California. Our experience spans all 12 districts with deep knowledge of regional requirements and local practices. Layout: List format with district details District 1 - North Region (Eureka) Counties: Del Norte, Humboldt, Lake, Mendocino District 2 - Northeast (Redding) Counties: Lassen, Modoc, Plumas, Shasta, Siskiyou, Tehama, Trinity District 3 - North Valley/Sierra (Marysville) Counties: Butte, Colusa, El Dorado, Glenn, Nevada, Placer, Sacramento, Sierra, Sutter, Yolo, Yuba District 4 - Bay Area (Oakland) Counties: Alameda, Contra Costa, Marin, Napa, San Francisco, San Mateo, Santa Clara, Solano, Sonoma District 5 - Central Coast (San Luis Obispo) Counties: Monterey, San Benito, San Luis Obispo, Santa Barbara, Santa Cruz District 6 - Central Valley (Fresno) Counties: Fresno, Kings, Madera, Mariposa, Merced, Tulare District 7 - Los Angeles/Ventura (Los Angeles) Counties: Los Angeles, Ventura District 8 - Inland Empire (San Bernardino) Counties: Riverside, San Bernardino District 9 - Eastern Sierra (Bishop) Counties: Inyo, Mono District 10 - Central Valley (Stockton) Counties: Alpine, Amador, Calaveras, San Joaquin, Stanislaus, Tuolumne District 11 - San Diego (San Diego) Counties: Imperial, San Diego District 12 - Orange County (Irvine) Counties: Orange

How We Support Your Caltrans Bid Layout: 5-step process with numbers/icons Step 1: Project Review You share the Caltrans project plans, specifications, and Special Provisions. We review safety requirements and identify which services are needed. Step 2: Fast Quote Turnaround We provide detailed pricing within 24-48 hours for inclusion in your bid package. Our quotes include labor rates, estimated hours, and all required deliverables. Step 3: Bid Support We're available to answer questions during bid preparation and can provide technical support for safety-related bid items. Step 4: Post-Award Mobilization Once you're awarded the contract, we mobilize quickly. Our Safety Representatives are ready to attend pre-construction meetings and begin work immediately. Step 5: Project Execution & Reporting We provide ongoing safety services throughout construction, complete all Caltrans submittals and reporting, and coordinate with your team and the Resident Engineer.
Our Caltrans Safety Credentials Layout: Badge/certification display format
Professional Certifications:

items: Certified Industrial Hygienist (CIH) - American Board of Industrial Hygiene
Certified Safety Professional (CSP) - Board of Certified Safety Professionals
Certified Asbestos Consultant (CAC) - State of California
CHST - Construction Health and Safety Technician

elements.text: Ready to Include Us in Your Caltrans Bid?

Body Text: Contact us today for fast, competitive pricing on Caltrans safety services. As a DVBE-certified firm, we help you meet small business participation goals while providing the highest level of safety expertise.
CTA Buttons: [Request Quote] [Download Capability Statement] [View Lead Compliance Services]
Contact Information: Phone: (619) 288-3094 Email: adam@ehsanalytical.com Based in San Diego, serving all 12 Caltrans districts

Frequently Asked Questions Q: Do you provide Safety Representatives for all project sizes? A: Yes, we support projects from small maintenance contracts to large highway construction projects exceeding $50M. Our team can scale services to match your project requirements. Q: Can you respond quickly during bidding season? A: Absolutely. We understand Caltrans bid deadlines are tight. We provide quotes within 24-48 hours and can turn around last-minute requests even faster with advance notice. Q: How does your DVBE certification help our bid? A: Caltrans awards a 5% bid preference to contractors who meet DVBE participation goals. Our subcontract counts toward your DVBE participation, making your bid more competitive. Q: Do you work directly with Caltrans Resident Engineers? A: Yes, our Safety Representatives attend all required meetings with the Resident Engineer, complete Cal/OSHA required Project Safety Reviews per Section 5-1.28, and handle all safety-related submittals and documentation. Q: Can you provide services in multiple districts simultaneously? A: Yes, we have the staff and resources to support multiple concurrent projects across different Caltrans districts. We'll assign dedicated personnel to each project. ══════════════════════════════════════════ END OF PART 3 CONTENT ══════════════════════════════════════════
